page.title: 02BUXTON, THE VILLAGE
page.content: Buxton lies on a cross-roads with the main route running north to south. The main village streets, however, run east to west. These are Crown Road and Mill Street. It is on these streets that most of the older properties are. There are three{public houses}though only two are in this D-BLOCK. They are The Crown, a 17th century building, and Boleyns, a new pub recently opened at the Mill. The{church}which is dedicated to St. Andrew, lies in the centre of the village along with the{Village Hall} and the{School. } In recent years there have been several new{property developments.} These are at Church Close, Levishaw Close, St.Andrew's Close, Bulwer Road and Manor Close. The other main building is the Mill which straddles the River Bure.
